quest.name: Rising Fortunes, Rising Spirits
journal: Conrad would like just as much as you to resume your march east towards the Peaks.
objectives: Speak with the Ala Mhigan Resistance gate guard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: From a stone bridge to a massive fortress... Garlean engineering never ceases to impress.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Now that we have taken control of Velodyna, there's nothing stopping us from marching east towards the Peaks.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If you're looking for Arenvald, I think he's with Pipin, searching the castellum for any remaining soldiers.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEGUARD
dialogue.text: Velodyna belongs to the Alliance and the Resistance now. You may be assured that the imperials will never hold it again!

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: I know you're not one for waiting, but if you'll bear with us─

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEGUARD
dialogue.text: Commander Kemp! Marshal Tarupin reports that their sweep of the castellum's interior has been completed!

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: So it's finally over, eh? Pray extend to him my deepest thanks.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's official, then. Castellum Velodyna is well and truly ours. Mayhap this calls for─ Wait, where is M'naago?

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: She took her bird and flew off towards the Peering Stones─the village of the M tribe, where she was born.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: I doubt that the imperials who fled Velodyna had a mind to give them trouble on their way back east, but she was nevertheless worried, so I gave her leave to go and see that her people were safe.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though I pray you are right, 'twould be best if M'naago were not alone if she should encounter the enemy.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Agreed! Let's all go to the Peering Stones and make sure that everything is all right.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: If that is your wish, then I've no objection. Just let the guard know when you wish to cross.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: For now we need to take stock of our supplies, tend to our wounded, and so forth. We'll resume our march east soon enough, but not yet.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEGUARD
dialogue.text: Greetings, Scion. Do you wish to pass?

dialogue.name: WARP
dialogue.text: Cross the bridge?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Did you say you were for the Peering Stones? In that case, mayhap Marshal Tarupin and I should join you.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: We spied a suspicious pair earlier─a Hyur and a Lalafell, by the looks of them─but they fled when they realized they'd been spotted. If they're imperials, then we can't have them stirring up trouble.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> On your guard, Arenvald. They're still about...

dialogue.name: VMAHTIA
dialogue.text: Since when did you become a bloodhound? A Miqo'te ought to trust their ears, not their nose.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: We will soon start sending scouts east to survey the land in preparation for our advance. We do not anticipate much resistance at this time, but should we encounter any imperial forces, we shall deal with them quickly and severely.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The path to the village is through a tunnel just east of here. Follow me!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...But of course. Tiring though it may be to come and go from the clifftop, it is easily defended and affords an excellent view of the surrounding area.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This area is home to dangerous beasts. Naught that we cannot handle, mind, but do not be surprised if something ravenous and slavering comes charging at you out of nowhere.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, what do you think? Hard to tell from down below that a whole village is up here, isn't it?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Not just Seekers of the Sun, but Ananta? Mayhap there is a settlement nearby...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We may not have seen any imperial forces thus far, but we mustn't forget that this was occupied territory until very recently. They could still be nearby.
